MIGLUSTAT

  • Indications and doses
  • Drug action
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Side effects
  • conception and contraception
  • Monitoring requirements
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Mild to moderate type I Gaucher's disease for whom enzyme replacement therapy is unsuitable (under expert supervision),

By mouth

  • For adults
    100 mg 3 times a day, reduced if not tolerated to 100 mg 1–2 times a day.

Treatment of progressive neurological manifestations of Niemann-Pick type C disease (under expert supervision),

By mouth

  • For adults
    200 mg 3 times a day.

Drug action

Miglustat is an inhibitor of glucosylceramide synthase.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid—toxicity in animal studies.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

No information available—manufacturer advises caution.

Advice regarding renal impairment

For Gaucher’s disease initially 100 mg twice daily if eGFR 50–70 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Initially 100 mg once daily if eGFR 30–50 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

For Niemann-Pick type C disease, initially 200 mg twice daily if eGFR 50–70 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Initially 100 mg twice daily if eGFR 30–50 mL/minute/1.73 m2

Avoid if eGFR less than 30 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Abdominal pain, amnesia, anorexia, ataxia, chills, constipation, decreased libido, depression, diarrhoea, dizziness, dyspepsia, flatulence, headache, hypoaesthesia, insomnia, malaise, muscle spasm, muscle weakness, nausea, paraesthesia, peripheral neuropathy, thrombocytopenia, tremor, vomiting, weight changes,

Advice regarding conception and contraception

Effective contraception must be used during treatment.

Men should avoid fathering a child during and for 3 months after treatment.

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor cognitive and neurological function.

Monitor growth and platelet count in Niemann-Pick type C disease.

Prepared medicinal forms of MIGLUSTAT

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Capsule
